what a great BBQ place in the heart of uptown.
very good BBQ and service.
im my opinion, this one of the best BBQ joints in Charlotte.
great BBQ and they are always friendly!food and a chill atmosphere.
possibly the best bbq restaurant in Charlotte.

mmmmm...such good BBQ!

i'm from NY so the BBQ sauce in most familiar with is the kind in the bottle from the grocery store like Kraft and this was a nice change of flavor profile.

they have several great BBQ sauces.
this superb BBQ joint in the heart of Charlotte's center city serves up juicy pulled pork, delicious mac n' cheese, and one of the best local beer menus in town.
bryan Meredith and his team have launched a great addition to the Charlotte BBQ market, and Queen City Q is fast-becoming my go-to spot for lunch in Uptown.

best BBQ joint in Charlotte!

there is a great selection of beer & wiskey along with some of the better BBQ in CLT.
it's totally a nice, clean, casual place to have bbq and brew.
I really enjoyed their signature BBQ sauce.

the absolute best bbq restaurant ever.
excellent BBQ just a short walking distance from the Epicenter.
good bbq.
it was a small price to pay for a delicious BBQ dinner.

they have a great showing of local brews as well... Everyone from Birdsong, OMB, NoDa Brewing and Four Friends are in the building and they have quite a few NC players as well...  Big Boss, Carolina Brewing, Foothills, Highland, LoneRider (YUM), Natty Greene's and RJ Rockers...

so I love BBQ....and to have a place in town is very C O O L. 

I dropped by one night and the place was dead, so I tried last night (Friday) and was pleasantly surprised to find the place filled with all kinds of folks.
they provide a decent variety of BBQ sauce and for the price, it's really hard to beat.
the BBQ (pulled pork) was really good, the Mac and Cheese was excellent, the red slaw was hideous.
the slaw was very fresh and tangy.
the ribs were slightly overcooked, brisket was dry, pulled pork had an acrid taste because it was over smoked, beans and NC slaw FLAVORLESS.
in Charlotte, we love our bbq.
the Eastern style is always my favorite and theirs was pretty tasty.
the ribs were tasty, the mac and cheese was yum, and the slaw was vinegary just like the Eastern NC bbq sauce.
while in Charlotte, NC, my girlfriend and I wanted to try the local barbecue food and were suggested Queen City Q by our hotel.
add the sweet potato fries that were crunchy, not soggy, and the baked beans, which had little bits of pork, and you've got bbq heaven.
this place makes its own sauces, which is always a good sign for a BBQ joint.
prices are extremely reasonable for good BBQ, and I recommend this place for tourists and locals alike.
had the brisket tacos minus the slaw and subbed raw onions for grilled with a side of Mac and cheese.
hot BBQ, they were amazing!
best BBQ place I've been to in Charlotte thus far.
came to NC for a wedding and after flying almost the entire length of the US we were hungry and looking for something good.
anyone looking for good BBQ and very friendly staff must go to Queen City Q.
I wish we had bbq this good in my hometown!
when I heard a BBQ joint was opening in Uptown, my reaction was "oh good, that'll be convenient - I hope it's decent."
their BBQ is pretty good, and competitively priced to other BBQ joints around town.
queen City had a great beer list and good, though not great, BBQ.
gREAT BBQ WITH FRIENDLY, GOOD SERVICE!
was in Charlotte last week for a conference and being a BBQ fanatic, I always look for the local places.
what we found were very friendly staff and a nicely laid out restaurant which the great smell of BBQ.
while this place probably isn't the best BBQ place in Charlotte, as proclaimed on their website, it's definitely a place you should visit if you're in town and have a craving for BBQ.
hands down the best BBQ in town and the best bar specials on week nights.
on a month long BBQ trail roadtrip through the Carolinas, Florida, NOLA and Tennessee Queen City Q ranked top 2 ... loved the ribs and chicken.
i'll just say that despite having lived in NC practically my whole life, I've never been a huge fan of BBQ nor mac n' cheese until I tried QCQ's catered BBQ at church a few weeks ago.
I had their hand-pulled pork with collard greens and mac n' cheese, and it was as good as BBQ gets!
the BBQ was all well seasoned and easy to consume.
perhaps you can find better BBQ if you want to drive to Lexington or somewhere else in remote areas.
this place serves good pork BBQ and several other great meat/entree options too!!
there are several great sides to choose from including mac-n-cheese, collard greens, and baked beans w/ Neese's (a Greensboro, NC company) sausage - these are all winners for me!
that's a good thing, because that means I can now get great BBQ in Uptown.
I eat alot of bbq and while Its not bad by any means, it is forgettable.
queen City Q was easily my go-to place within walking distance of my hotel to grab an authentic bite of Carolina BBQ.
i'm quite surprised that more good BBQ doesn't exist in Charlotte!
I would have thought, Southern city = Great BBQ.
queen City Q is really a great BBQ joint.
there was some great BBQ!
hopefully, others will discover this great BBQ joint.
bBQ is good and their bar is top notch.
I had the pulled pork plate which was good and the eastern bbq was good too (though would have preferred to seen some Lexington BBQ sauce).
in town for one night and decided to try this because I wanted BBQ and the reviews were good.
bBQ isn't bad.
good bbq joint.
best of all is that they serve real barbecue slaw which I can not find anywhere around Charlotte.
very good BBQ!
also they have some of the best sides of any BBQ place I have ever been.
bBQ as good as it gets in the Queen City!
I don't take advantage of this enough, unfortunately, because I'm always a fatty when I go here and just throw down on BBQ.
the NC slaw is right on and tangy.
and what's better than BBQ?
these sliders were tender, flavorful, and served with a nice slaw on top between a perfectly toasted, slightly buttery, bun.
I would totally recommend this place to anyone coming into uptown who wants some yummy BBQ.
the food came out promptly and the pickle and the added SC BBQ added made a perfect sweet sour tangy taste and I fully recommend you try it for yourself.
heard it was the best BBQ in Charlotte.

the awesome beer list was amazing and they had some rare stuff, local dunkel.

another great bonus: They have a massive beer selection!
if you love local beer, this is the place for you too!
the best thing this place has going for them is that it's kind of funky decor and great local beer selection.
great barbecue and great beer...what more can you ask for?
it's definitely one of the top 3 beer spots in downtown Charlotte.
if you want a local beer, there's no better place to try them ALL.
the beer list was solid and offered a nice spread of N.C. brews.
the St Louis ribs are great.
delicious, juicy, sweet and tangy ribs.
the St. Louis style ribs here are quite tasty (if a little more peppery than I prefer) and slathered in sauce and totally reasonably priced.
all of the meats were smoky, succulent and tasty, particularly the St. Louis ribs.
love the wings and ribs and it's all good enough to eat everyday
pulled pork with different bbq sauce options, sweet potato fries, green bean casserole, Mac and cheese, local brews.
the pork was okay, not my favorite and my fries were raw...which was very disappointing because I love me some good fries.
the food was pretty solid (pulled pork), price fair, and there was a nice selection of beer on tap.
to me the pork was a bit dry as was the bread it was served on.
the pork on the sliders was dry and tasted like it had been sitting around a while.
the barbecue: Succulent, tender pulled pork in a delicious sauce.
hushpuppies are great as is the briskett quesadilla, pulled pork, and chicken.
the kids love the root beer floats and I love the St. Louis ribs.
the ribs had a great combination of flavor and leanness, the sausage was exceptionally good, and everything else was at least average.
I also loved tasting the vinegar based Carolina style BBQ sauces.
the Q Platter left much to be desired; pulled pork was dry with charred ends, brisket was too fatty and the ribs left little to no meat on the bone.
this superb BBQ joint in the heart of Charlotte's center city serves up juicy pulled pork, delicious mac n' cheese, and one of the best local beer menus in town.
food was super (buffalo wings, brunswick stew, chicken tacos, ribs, bbq - all yummy).
first off the brisket and ribs were delicious - not something you can easily find up north.
the pork at Queen City Q is hand-pulled slow roasted bone-in pork butt, and it makes for a sandwich that's tender and juicy.
I asked for some West Coast style IPAs, and they offered some local options that were decently hoppy.
I loved the pulled pork, hush puppies with whipped honey butter, homemade chips, corn mix thingy with bacon that was amazing, ribs, and everything else.
the fall-off-the-bone ribs and tender, succulent brisket ranks as some of the best barbecue I have ever had.
the pulled pork plate was great, the pork retained its juice well and was not dry at all (I'm looking at you Smoke).
nice smoke on the pork as well.
located close to the 7th St. light rail stop, it's a perfect place to ride & dine.
the BBQ (pulled pork) was really good, the Mac and Cheese was excellent, the red slaw was hideous.
and the pork...  it was most excellent!
the ribs were slightly overcooked, brisket was dry, pulled pork had an acrid taste because it was over smoked, beans and NC slaw FLAVORLESS.
this is my 2nd time here and the wings and pulled pork are still delicious.
don't get me wrong, it was tasty, if pricey, food - pulled pork with a bevy of sauces to choose from, wings, mac & cheese, hushpuppies.
the ribs were pretty tasty while the brisket was a little dry.
the ribs are great and the pulled pork - best thing on the menu and that's saying A LOT!
while I have to admit that I had better pulled pork and not a fan of the vinegar-based sauces, I did enjoy the food here.
the only thing my husband didn't love were the ribs (he thought they were too smoky).
this place can stand up to the top spots in and around the city as far as the pork goes!
the Eastern style is always my favorite and theirs was pretty tasty.
the ribs were tasty, the mac and cheese was yum, and the slaw was vinegary just like the Eastern NC bbq sauce.
brisket, pulled port and ribs are all great.
pork sausage was AMAZING.
add the sweet potato fries that were crunchy, not soggy, and the baked beans, which had little bits of pork, and you've got bbq heaven.
the St. Louis style pork ribs are tasty and tender.
I was really happy with the experience, from the trivia to the well-priced drinks and of course the delicious ribs!
pulled pork was delicious.
their sauces compliment the pork very well too.
my friend had the beef brisket, which was decent (again, I've had better), and we were offered a sample of their St. Louis pork ribs which were great for the price (free!
the basic Pork sauce is a nice mix of tomato and vinegar.
the pork has always been tender and cooked/smoked well.
the ribs were delicious!
further more the pork was very dry and could have used a bit of sauce.
on a month long BBQ trail roadtrip through the Carolinas, Florida, NOLA and Tennessee Queen City Q ranked top 2 ... loved the ribs and chicken.
I had their hand-pulled pork with collard greens and mac n' cheese, and it was as good as BBQ gets!
the pulled pork, brisket, ribs, collared greens, beans with sausage was all very good.
they weren't the shredded up, over-sauced bit I've come to associate with pulled pork--these were closer to sliced pork, with a tangy cabbage/greens topping and were simply tasty.
this place serves good pork BBQ and several other great meat/entree options too!!
the ribs, brisket, chicken, and even the smoked sausage are all really good!
most of us got 3 meat plates - I had brisket, ribs and pulled pork - all very good and there were 6 different sauces on the table to add if needed.
I went to this place for lunch yesterday to have the ribs since I always here people talking about great they are.
I love their pull pork sandwich.
I love their ribs and you have a selection of sauces at you table to choose from.

pork isn't the only option here there's brisket, ribs, chicken
& local sausages.
pulled pork tasted like it had been shredded the day before and reheated.
the pork sliders are the best.
the sauces served on the table for you to slather on your good pork eats are finger-lickin' good.
the ribs are also another fave of mine.
the baked beans were too sweet for our taste, good southern style I suppose.
the next day had a few bites of cold pork and the mac and they were just as good, if not better, than the day before.
the ribs are tasty, though they often have broken bones.
all in all, the Q Is a great place to go if you have a hankerin' for a meal that will stick to your ribs and put a smile on your sauce-covered face.
ribs and brisket are good.
even Applebee's and Chili's ribs are better.
our group was served pulled pork sliders and craft beers with our choice of any and all of their six sauces, and they were amazing!
the food (the sausage and pulled pork) is really tasty.
pulled pork sandwich was great.
this time we shared a Queen City sampler which included some killer St. Louis style ribs, a decent piece of barbecued chicken, a good sausage, and some tender brisket.
the pork was extremely disappointing, though the quantity of the food was worth the price.
based on some dry and flavorless pulled pork and an over-mayo'd turkey salad wrap, I have no intention of going out of my way to visit Queen City Q's brick and mortar location.
I had the classic pulled pork sandwich--the tender pork being so plentiful I had to ditch the bun (good, I'm sure) in favor of a fork and knife.
the chicken was juicy, the chili was spicy, the cheese wasn't all clumpy, and the chips were crunchy.
I love just a plain ole Grilled Cheese and some pasta salad.
we started with the pretzel and beer cheese, a great choice.
so then you have a meatball tasting meat, add in blue cheese and buffalo, and it's an odd combo, and not a pleasing one.
I ordered 'The Muse' which is a turkey, roast beef and swiss sandwich placed on a croissant with horseradish sauce; it was pretty good.
grilled cheese cooked to perfection (people mess them up more often than not), tots are always good, wraps, reubens, sundials, all really good bar food.
I returned because I was craving a good fish sandwich.
cheap food and the best cheese fries.
they put their house-made beer cheese on it and it was just amazing.
this place is as amazing a tavern as you will find in Charlotte.
this almost broke my heart, because I wanted to love the Bavarian Burger.
went to Solstice Tavern last night, and had an overall good experience.

the food was good, although we had our hearts set on the mushroom/swiss/bacon burger advertised on the chalkboard outside, and when we ordered found out they were on the late night menu (which is basically only food that is deep-fried.)
that was a tasty burger.
although they offer most of the traditional stand-by's that any tavern should carry, their menu transcends conventionality in pub fare.
the Solstice Tavern is by far my all-time favorite spot in NoDa.
so beware the burger choices unless this sounds good to you.
I came in here for lunch today with a friend and we were just roaming around looking for a place to grab lunch at an inexpensive price and a pleasant atmosphere so we stopped in Solstice Tavern.
the veggie burger was tasty though.
I had the veggie burger and it was delicious and the fries were good too.
my blackened chicken wrap came out so cold I honestly believe it was sitting the fridge waiting for my fries to be made.
we ended up getting chicken fingers and fries which were good.
the fries were crispy and seasoned well.
I had the veggie burger and it was delicious and the fries were good too.
fries aren't the best though, get the tator tots.... the fries all over Charlotte seem to be like cardboard with "Cajun" seasoned salt... very friendly staff and welcoming environment.
it was accompanied by about a dozen crinkle cut fries coated in seasoned salt.

loved the crowd eclectic and exciting, regarding the food ordered nachos, these were a disappointment as way too much pepper which was weird I wouldn't recommend these then ordered wings and fries which were very good.
cheap food and the best cheese fries.
the fries were great too.
(I favored Cilantro better - very refreshing and good am for summer).
loved the cilantro cocktail.
I also tasted the chicken and brussel sprouts and enjoyed them both as well.
the super grain salad was very good, the Chardonnay was ok, and the Pomegranate drink was extremely good.
I love the salad with no lettuce ...
the Rotisserie Chicken is excellent and very juicy!
moist delicious perfectly seasoned chicken with every bite!
I loved lightly smoked fish and the chicken was moist, tender and had a nice smokiness.
for entrees the Chicken was super moist and flavorful.
also loved the half chicken.
we went on a Sunday during lunch and it was the perfect atmosphere!
everything from the Greek salad, sandwiches and back lava we had was amazing!!
went for a Saturday lunch, there was a good crowd.
the chicken was AMAZING!
this was my third time and I had a delicious lunch with family.
my daughter had the chicken pizza of the kids menu - lots of chicken, looked delicious, she could only eat half, very generous portion.
the cilantro drink was quite tasty, though very sweet.
I recommend trying the spinach and cheese dip, the chicken, the potatoes au gratin and the beet salad.
I also had the Cilantro drink was very good.
the chicken was roasted well and pulled perfectly.
it also blended well with the salad as the leaves werent too cold or crunchy.
coming from NYC, I had a strict loyalty to Pio Pio because of my love for Peruvian chicken.
the chicken was tender and juicy.
we ordered the grilled octopus, small plate of hummus, spiced feta, and tzatziki, pulled pork panini, and the super grain salad - all fantastic!
we then ordered a super grains  salad with chicken which my wife said was delicious (looked great) and I had the gyro.
(meat) Chicken [$17.00 for whole] - Nice and tender, and quite large (we took half home).
we really loved the half chicken and pork shoulder...the flavors were outstanding.
I enjoyed an incredible salad with quinoa, chicken, and avocado.
after hearing so many great things about Kid Cashew, we were excited to try it for a Sunday lunch.
the chicken and Brussel sprouts were delicious.
we also ordered the lamb, which is what our server suggested given our other items (initially we were going to get the roasted chicken).
truly, Kid Cashew is a Fantastic spot for lunch!
first the salad came out and my gosh was it salty.
every other bite had a huge grain of salt that I bit into and was too salty to finish...how can a salad be too salty to eat?!
I like the grain salad, and all of the proteins are good.
the salad couscous that was underneath the trout was absolutely amazing.

maybe 3 fingerlings in a bowl of cheesy onions), the open face chicken sandwich (our server told us it's more of a chicken salad - and it was- so don't expect a breast of chicken or normal sandwich) and a gelato sundae (really disappointing.. they must have forgotten it because it came out melted and the server kinda shrugged it off when we asked).
I thoroughly enjoyed  my Pulled Chicken, Lime (I think, or lemon) Cilantro Sandwich- on toasted sourdough bread.
all the food we ordered was delicious, albeit pricey -- beets, brussels sprouts, garden salad, trout fillet, and mac & cheese.
the roasted chicken was also very good.
they're consistently busy for lunch and dinner; excellent patio - East Boulevard is great for people watching anyway!
yesterday's late lunch was relaxing and each dish was prepared and presented in a very appetizing manner.
they have great Mac and cheese and a super greens or super food salad that is .
they timed our lunch well.
for lunch I had the half chicken which I really had to order after watching 6 of them spinning on the rotisserie looking scrumptious.
the cilantro drink was great!
I highly recommend the Brussels, the octopus (tastes pretty authentically Greek) and the roasted chicken is outstanding.
wife & split the chicken, brussel sprouts and the Greek salad along with a couple of very refreshing cocktails.
the greek salad was good.
first the good:  My salad with quinoa, pistachios and avocado was really good if not hard to eat.

dish_name: dinner all natural wood-fired chicken avocado sandwich

dish_name: dinner all natural wood-fired chicken avocado sandwich
review: I enjoyed an incredible salad with quinoa, chicken, and avocado.

review: the lemon-oregano chicken sandwich is an open faced sandwich with great flavors.

dish_name: dinner all natural wood-fired chicken avocado sandwich
review: the chicken and Brussel sprouts were delicious.

dish_name: dinner all natural wood-fired chicken avocado sandwich
review: the mac and cheese, Brussels sprouts, spinach dip and a chicken sandwich were all great choices.

dish_name: dinner all natural wood-fired chicken avocado sandwich
review: the portion of the sandwich was perfect.

dinner:

The macaroni and cheese was excellent.

dish_name: dinner all natural wood-fired chicken avocado sandwich
review: ever since my birthday dinner, this restaurant is by far the best restaurant I've ever been to in Charlotte.

dish_name: dinner all natural wood-fired chicken avocado sandwich
review: decided to come here for my birthday dinner with my best friend.

dish_name: dinner all natural wood-fired chicken avocado sandwich
review: maybe 3 fingerlings in a bowl of cheesy onions), the open face chicken sandwich (our server told us it's more of a chicken salad - and it was- so don't expect a breast of chicken or normal sandwich) and a gelato sundae (really disappointing.. they must have forgotten it because it came out melted and the server kinda shrugged it off when we asked).

dish_name: dinner all natural wood-fired chicken avocado sandwich
review: I thoroughly enjoyed  my Pulled Chicken, Lime (I think, or lemon) Cilantro Sandwich- on toasted sourdough bread.

dish_name: dinner all natural wood-fired chicken avocado sandwich
review: the roasted chicken was also very good.

dish_name: dinner all natural wood-fired chicken avocado sandwich
review: they're consistently busy for lunch and dinner; excellent patio - East Boulevard is great for people watching anyway!

dish_name: dinner all natural wood-fired chicken avocado sandwich
review: enjoyed the open-face chicken sandwich with a side of magic beans while my wife loved her Super Salad.

dish_name: dinner all natural wood-fired chicken avocado sandwich
review: for lunch I had the half chicken which I really had to order after watching 6 of them spinning on the rotisserie looking scrumptious.

dish_name: dinner all natural wood-fired chicken avocado sandwich
review: -lamb sandwich - also very good and rich, perfectly cooked.

dish_name: dinner all natural wood-fired chicken avocado sandwich
review: awesome place to come with a dinner club and share your dishes!!

dish_name: dinner all natural wood-fired chicken avocado sandwich
review: I highly recommend the Brussels, the octopus (tastes pretty authentically Greek) and the roasted chicken is outstanding.

dish_name: dinner all natural wood-fired chicken avocado sandwich
review: wife & split the chicken, brussel sprouts and the Greek salad along with a couple of very refreshing cocktails.

dish_name: dinner all natural wood-fired chicken avocado sandwich
review: first the good:  My salad with quinoa, pistachios and avocado was really good if not hard to eat.
(I favored Cilantro better - very refreshing and good am for summer).
it's great for a date night, or a group dinner with friends.
loved the cilantro cocktail.
the place was packed, with a variety of customers, from friends to couples to even families enjoying Sunday dinner.
I also tasted the chicken and brussel sprouts and enjoyed them both as well.
the super grain salad was very good, the Chardonnay was ok, and the Pomegranate drink was extremely good.
I love the salad with no lettuce ...
the Rotisserie Chicken is excellent and very juicy!
moist delicious perfectly seasoned chicken with every bite!
I loved lightly smoked fish and the chicken was moist, tender and had a nice smokiness.
for entrees the Chicken was super moist and flavorful.
what a great dinner experience all around!
also loved the half chicken.
everything from the Greek salad, sandwiches and back lava we had was amazing!!
the chicken was AMAZING!
my daughter had the chicken pizza of the kids menu - lots of chicken, looked delicious, she could only eat half, very generous portion.
the cilantro drink was quite tasty, though very sweet.
I recommend trying the spinach and cheese dip, the chicken, the potatoes au gratin and the beet salad.
my dinner partner had the mushroom sandwich and he enjoyed it.
I also had the Cilantro drink was very good.
the chicken was roasted well and pulled perfectly.
it also blended well with the salad as the leaves werent too cold or crunchy.
i'd definitely recommend for a group dinner on the patio!
coming from NYC, I had a strict loyalty to Pio Pio because of my love for Peruvian chicken.
the chicken was tender and juicy.
we ordered the grilled octopus, small plate of hummus, spiced feta, and tzatziki, pulled pork panini, and the super grain salad - all fantastic!
we then ordered a super grains  salad with chicken which my wife said was delicious (looked great) and I had the gyro.
visited this place in the first week it was open and got to have dinner with some good friends from church.
(meat) Chicken [$17.00 for whole] - Nice and tender, and quite large (we took half home).
we really loved the half chicken and pork shoulder...the flavors were outstanding.
I enjoyed an incredible salad with quinoa, chicken, and avocado.
the chicken and Brussel sprouts were delicious.
we also ordered the lamb, which is what our server suggested given our other items (initially we were going to get the roasted chicken).
first the salad came out and my gosh was it salty.
every other bite had a huge grain of salt that I bit into and was too salty to finish...how can a salad be too salty to eat?!
I like the grain salad, and all of the proteins are good.

dinner:

The macaroni and cheese was excellent.
the salad couscous that was underneath the trout was absolutely amazing.
ever since my birthday dinner, this restaurant is by far the best restaurant I've ever been to in Charlotte.
decided to come here for my birthday dinner with my best friend.

maybe 3 fingerlings in a bowl of cheesy onions), the open face chicken sandwich (our server told us it's more of a chicken salad - and it was- so don't expect a breast of chicken or normal sandwich) and a gelato sundae (really disappointing.. they must have forgotten it because it came out melted and the server kinda shrugged it off when we asked).
I thoroughly enjoyed  my Pulled Chicken, Lime (I think, or lemon) Cilantro Sandwich- on toasted sourdough bread.
all the food we ordered was delicious, albeit pricey -- beets, brussels sprouts, garden salad, trout fillet, and mac & cheese.
the roasted chicken was also very good.
they're consistently busy for lunch and dinner; excellent patio - East Boulevard is great for people watching anyway!
they have great Mac and cheese and a super greens or super food salad that is .
for lunch I had the half chicken which I really had to order after watching 6 of them spinning on the rotisserie looking scrumptious.
awesome place to come with a dinner club and share your dishes!!
the cilantro drink was great!
I highly recommend the Brussels, the octopus (tastes pretty authentically Greek) and the roasted chicken is outstanding.
wife & split the chicken, brussel sprouts and the Greek salad along with a couple of very refreshing cocktails.
the greek salad was good.
first the good:  My salad with quinoa, pistachios and avocado was really good if not hard to eat.
wings for the most part have been good if you like the Hooters style wing.

and if you need to see some eye candy while you eat wings and drink beer there are plenty of internet sites you can enjoy in the comfort of your own home while eating wings and drinking much cheaper beer.
boneless wings were okay, fries were cold, Arnold Palmer wasn't so great.
can you imagine the aroma of the combo of wings and clorox?
I stuck it out and the wings were fine, beer was cold and the bartender was pleasant and did a good job.
hell, the Hooters in Puerto Vallarta had better wings.
it took another 5 min for our food to come out and the two all you can eat wings were slightly cold and did not have fries.
we could of ordered better tasting chicken wings from a Gas Station.
I love, love, LOVE wings and sadly Hooter's can't even do a decent wing.
overall I think the shrimp is a good addition to the menu and I'm glad to see Hooters is branching off from its normal wings and beer options.
the wings were good, too.

the "au poivre" sauce was a perfect accompaniment to the expertly seasoned steak.
I ordered a lovely charcuterie plate as an appetizer which was excellent and a main course of beouf and pommes frites (hanger steak and French fries).
my fresh pasta dish was perfectly done with a lamb ragout.

octopus makes you sing "I'm in love the the Pulpo"  while the Pheasant and Lamb Tagine  are extremely impressive (Pictures Posted) 

5 Star experience, service, food, and great anniversary memory!
then we split a pasta entre which was tagliatelle with lamb Ragu and was suggested to us by our helpful and cheery server.
wife and I shared foie gras, burata/tomatoes, Duck confit, pheasant, and chocolate souffl... All very tasty.
highly recommend the chocolate souffl and duck.
I was pleasantly surprised when I first ordered from them, the vegetables in my veggie mai fun and in my husband's fried rice were fresh and plentiful!
wings were good, shrimp fried rice was surprisingly good also!
I love this restaurant very good food and the vegetables are fresh and customer service is very good and also the people who work there are respectful and nice :) I love eating there
I ordered the SaCha chicken and shrimp which was great!
the Vegetables were good and tasted like peas, carrots, broccoli, etc.
wings were good, shrimp fried rice was surprisingly good also!
I ordered the SaCha chicken and shrimp which was great!
first, the seafood was good steamed.

I ordered the SaCha chicken and shrimp which was great!
the Vegetables were good and tasted like peas, carrots, broccoli, etc.
my Bolognese was outstanding, quite hearty with a what I believe to have been a pork and veal combo with tomatoes and cheese.
when I think of a bolognese, I think of a meaty, rich sauce clinging to each piece of pasta.
homemade obviously with a nice bolognese it was perfect!!!
their bolognese is some of the best I've ever had - it's extremely flavorful and just plain amazing.
with a variety of sauces to choose from, I chose the bolognese sauce, again with disappointing results.
expecting a rich, hearty, slow braised meat, veal & pork and vegetable sauce, typical of a bolognese sauce, theirs was sparse with meat and lacked any resemblance of vegetables.
well, gnocchi is pretty time consuming to create, so that's the day they offer it at Dolce.
stepping off my ivory gnocchi tower, the restaurant scores well in other categories as well.
just had an Amazing Gnocchi with Lobster in a light cream sauce.
the gnocchi was delicate and tasty.
the lobster well very complimentary to the gnocchi did not seems as fresh as the waiter might have promised.
for entrees we got the vodka penne with chicken and the gnocci (we unknowingly went on gnocchi night) which were both great.

I was here Tuesdays when they have their house made gnocchi - I think it's delicious 
I tried it with 4 cheese sauce - not to much sauce and a nice size of soft melting gnocchi
Also the waiter was very nice and did a good job.
our server recommended a great wine, based upon my liking and was more than happy to offer info re: the restaurant's "Gnocchi Tuesday's" that we'd read about online.
amazing pesto gnocchi and delicious penne al la vodka.
I keep buying LivingSocials when they have them so I can eat delicious, delicious gnocchi at a more reasonable price point.
when they have it as a special, I entirely recommend the lobster gnocchi.
it's pillowy gnocchi in parmesan cream sauce with nice, big lobster chunks, sun dried tomatoes, and spinach.
I enjoyed some of the best gnocchi I've ever had, and my wife enjoyed a succulent serving of chicken Napoli.
since I am not local to Charlotte I did my homework through Yelp, as I always do, and found all the comments about Gnocchi Tuesdays, so i was ready.
the gnocchi was wonderful - tender and very tasty.
my husband loves good gnocchi.
the first time we went here it was on a Tuesday so we could try the gnocchi because we had heard how delicious it was.
i've had much better gnocchi...Aria for example.
we came on a Tuesday because we heard this is the only night they serve fresh gnocchi.
gnocchi is one of my favorite Italian dishes and Docle Ristorante did it right.
each bite of the four-cheese gnocchi (my personal favorite), is like tasting soft pillows of heavenly goodness.
one which has visited their homeland quite a few times and been to numerous restaurants that serve "authentic" gnocchi.
go on Tuesday night for the amazing homemade gnocchi!
I went to Italy this summer and this easily rivaled the best gnocchi I had there.
gnocchi night is also impressive, with fluffy and delicate gnocchi accompanied by delicious sauces and proteins that are typically aligned to the seasons.
onto the highly anticipated gnocchi......expecting a culinary delight, I was greatly disappointed with the quality - too soft and over cooked.
they have, hands down, the best gnocchi in Charlotte - it's just unfortunate that it's only available on Tuesdays!

i've gotten Dolce a few times, usually via Foodie Call.. the pollo entre (chicken scaloppini stuffed with ham, fresh spinach & cheese) is always good, and on Tuesdays the gnocchi with four cheese sauce is amazing - little pillows of deliciousness in your mouth.
hubby and I both ended up getting the gnocchi as well, mine with the 4 cheese sauce and his with the pesto.
the Tuesday gnocchi is definitely worth trying out, and you would be hard pressed to find a better Italian restaurant in the QC.
I think I might only go on Tuesdays haha because I have a feeling their gnocchi is the best thing on the menu.
there is no better gnocchi than at Dolce on Tuesdays.
we'll definitely be back in the future, and I would really like to return on a Tuesday when they make their fresh gnocchi.
come on Tuesdays- fresh gnocchi!
my Bolognese was outstanding, quite hearty with a what I believe to have been a pork and veal combo with tomatoes and cheese.

*head explodes*

Well, I went with the four cheese because I was at home and I was already sportin' my sweatpants.

I was here Tuesdays when they have their house made gnocchi - I think it's delicious 
I tried it with 4 cheese sauce - not to much sauce and a nice size of soft melting gnocchi
Also the waiter was very nice and did a good job.
my favorite dish is the Amatriciana and the limoncello cake is to die for.
for dolce or dessert, I elected to enjoy the Limoncello Chiffon Cake!
I enjoyed every flavor in that cake.

i've gotten Dolce a few times, usually via Foodie Call.. the pollo entre (chicken scaloppini stuffed with ham, fresh spinach & cheese) is always good, and on Tuesdays the gnocchi with four cheese sauce is amazing - little pillows of deliciousness in your mouth.
hubby and I both ended up getting the gnocchi as well, mine with the 4 cheese sauce and his with the pesto.
my wife enjoyed the cheese filled eggplant roulades too.
wild mushroom ravioli with lobster creamy cheese sauce was awesome!
deserts are very good, especially the lemon cheese cake and the gelato.
the fries were a bit salty.
the chicken was juicy the fries were perfect and the rice with the garlic sauce was tasty.
good French fries.
all wraps came with delicious fries.
ok, I had the hummus to start (very fresh), and the beef kabobs, with the yummiest rice, salad AND fries?
I sent them back and they gave me fresh fries which took much longer than the first wait I had.

good food - wings, hot shots, etc.. Service leaves some to be desired - depending on when you go.
living in Charlotte, almost everyone who sells wings claim they have the best.
I had the ginger wings and it was surprisingly good.
wings were super crispy - got half hot and half wild west/ranch flavor - and the sauces were perfect.
tasteless wings.
wings and fries were over cooked and dry.
wings are good, with plenty of flavors, and you have to try the buffarella (sure i spelled this wrong).
I have been to Wild Wings all over the southeast and they are fantastic.
well, the wings were perfectly done and still hot when they got to the table.
luckily, I've learned my lesson over the years, and Wild Wing does a pretty good job of coating their chicken with sauce anyway.
wings are overlooked, hard, and not labeled.
wings are always flavorful and hot.
marissa is a great server, in my (picky) opinion :) The food is consistent, and the wings are delicious.
mile High nachos has to be my favorite appetizer and the wings...well they are pretty dang good.
my favorite wings are lemon pepper, wild west, red, hot & bleu, ranchilada, & island jerk.
aND THE BONELESS WINGS WE ALL LOVED ARE BACK!

marissa is a great server, in my (picky) opinion :) The food is consistent, and the wings are delicious.
mile High nachos has to be my favorite appetizer and the wings...well they are pretty dang good.
my favorite wings are lemon pepper, wild west, red, hot & bleu, ranchilada, & island jerk.
aND THE BONELESS WINGS WE ALL LOVED ARE BACK!
also makes for a great casual date if you're dating the type of girl that's into wings and sports!
good food - wings, hot shots, etc.. Service leaves some to be desired - depending on when you go.
living in Charlotte, almost everyone who sells wings claim they have the best.
I had the ginger wings and it was surprisingly good.
wings were super crispy - got half hot and half wild west/ranch flavor - and the sauces were perfect.
tasteless wings.
wings and fries were over cooked and dry.
wings are good, with plenty of flavors, and you have to try the buffarella (sure i spelled this wrong).
I have been to Wild Wings all over the southeast and they are fantastic.
well, the wings were perfectly done and still hot when they got to the table.
luckily, I've learned my lesson over the years, and Wild Wing does a pretty good job of coating their chicken with sauce anyway.

so I went for a "quick" lunch today and ordered a simple fried rice and waited 20 minutes,when I caught the woman at the counter realize that my order wasn't placed so she sent the order and preceded to argue with another customer about a take out that was done wrong.
the teryaki chicken was tough and there was so much rice.
drizzle that over that rice n you will have a nice treat... thank me later!

first, my disclaimer:  i have done business with DNG beyond the scope of pulling up a barstool on a sunday and screaming at the many televisions while drinking reasonably priced draft and bottled beer and stuffing my face with their tasty barfare grub.
dNG has a great atmosphere for grabbing a beer and watching a game on one of their many big screen TVs.
their wine and beer prices are great and I enjoy meeting with friends here for drinks and dinner on many occasions.
always great beer specials and fast service.
loved the spin dip and the carne asada taco.
they also have lots of great beer on tap!
they have a very nice beer selection as well.
dNG has a very nice bar with plenty of drinks to choose from, be it wine, beer, or spirits!
great place to grab some wings and a beer.
I had the beer cheese dip with a large soft pretzel to dip into it.
I have had the crab cakes on another occasion and would suggest that for an app over the dip for sure as those I do remember being really good.
good beer selection.
they saw my empty beer in the well several times and didn't ask me if I wanted another and almost appeared to avoid eye contact.
the food is great, fun local beer specials, and absolutely wonderful staff!
I got a side of mac and cheese and it was terrible.
it's just elbow noodles and cheese, I have no idea how anybody could make Mac 'n' Cheese that bad.
even so, the patio is really big and nice, and they have a huge, excellent beer selection.
their fries taste like McDonald's fries, which are good.
dilworth Neighborhood Grille has pretty good bar food (burgers, fries, etc) and good drink specials.
they have a decent cheesesteak, i am always a fan of chicken fingers, and their fries are not to shabby either.
I love the chicken philly (the fries here are probably some of the best I have had in Charlotte!)
delicious food- some of the best fries I have had.
my boyfriend had wings and fries,wing where warm ,not fresh and fries tasted old.
my husband's fries as well as my sweet potato fries were on the cool side.
the fries were thinly sliced and tasty not with that greasy after taste.
the Delmonico Steak Sandwich was really good, the homemade chips and the fries were also great!
the club sandwich is tall and tasty and the seasoned fries are awesome.

sweet potato fries are good too.

rudeness, attitude with a side of bad food

After a long hiatus from eating there, due to spotty service and mediocre food, my fiance and I went there for breakfast on Mother's day.
had a good little breakfast for under $6.00.
I did have breakfast here once before and it wasn't this bad.
I am a big fan of breakfast & brunch, so I am always on the lookout for new options.
if you are a fan of diners, this is a great spot for Breakfast.

great egg salad sandwich, seafood, sandwiches, Italian, banana pudding, meat and potatoes.

review: the Cubano sandwich, Cobb salad, Chicken Caprese sandwich, and coleslaw with crasins were all tasty and well prepared.

dish_name: homemade chicken salad du jour sandwich
review: today, I had a roast pork tenderloin in a dreamy mushroom sauce, some incredible collard greens, and an orzo/black-eyed pea salad concoction that was outstanding.

review: I was lucky enough to attend one of their catering events and it was southern BBQ/BBQ chicken was delicious!
